intro: Haplopappus albicans, commonly known as the white pappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in a flat-topped inflorescence. Its leaves are typically linear and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Haplopappus albicans is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
